Getting the Dataset

  1. Get All Data
  2. Check Data
  3. Filtered Search
  4. Get Only Music Data
  5. Get Data One by One

Get All Data

We provide 13,939 videos with 60 musical pieces which sum up to several Terabytes in total. We describe its structure at [Database Structure]. Every file in the database comes with a unique URL so that each file is separately downloadable. To get the dataset in whole, download the [list] containing pairs of filenames and URLs into a directory, and then execute download at the same directory by typing the following command:

$ wget "https://aistdancedb.ongaaccel.jp/"

Check Data

Compare the total file size to the one described in the [list]. If they match, the files are downloaded successfully.

Filtered Search

To filter the downloading files depending on the purpose, you can take advantage of the format of the filenames. The filename contains information regarding the dance genre, situation, dancer, camera, music, and the take. For instance,

gHO_sBM_c02_d20_mHO4_ch09.mp4

can be comprehended as

{Genre}_{Situation}_{Camera}_{Dancer}_{Music}_{Take}.mp4.

Please see [Formats] for the more detailed description for the filename format.

Here are the examples of commands to filter out files upon specific requests.

files recorded with the front camera

$ cat list.csv | grep *_c01_*

files containing "Basic Dance" only

$ cat list.csv | grep *_sBM_*

files of Dancer01 recorded with the front camera

$ cat list.csv | grep *_c01_d01_*

Get Only Music Data

You can also download the music used in the videos.

$ wget https://aistdancedb.jp/music/*

Get Data One by One

You can download a file separately by clicking the link at [Database Download].
